gap.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: a space between two objects or two parts of an object, especially because something is missing
gap.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: The neighbors’ dog got in through a gap in the hedge.
the gap between the two rows of seats
gap.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: a big difference between two situations, amounts, groups of people etc
gap.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: the widening gap between the rich and the poor
gap.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: something missing that stops something else from being good or complete
gap.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: He filled the gap left by Hirst’s retirement.
There are huge gaps in my knowledge of history.
Frank’s death has left a big gap in my life.
gap.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: a period of time when nothing is happening, that exists between two other periods of time when something is happening
gap.translation[0].definitions[3].exampl: an awkward gap in the conversation
The gaps between his visits got longer and longer.
gap.translation[0].definitions[4].defini: a low place between two higher parts of a mountain
gap.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 2: a big difference between two situations, amounts, groups of people etc
gap.translation[0].note_box[0].sections[: ADJECTIVES/NOUN + gap
a big/large/wide gap
There’s a big gap between the two test scores.
a huge/substantial etc gap
A huge gap exists between the life styles of the rich and the poor.
a narrow gap
There’s only a narrow gap between the two candidates in the polls.
a yawning gap
There’s a yawning gap between the earnings of men and women.
a growing/widening gap
There is a widening gap in the academic performance of boys and girls.
an unbridgeable gap
He felt that there was an unbridgeable gap between the negotiating positions of the two sides.
a trade gap
Britain’s trade gap almost doubled last month.
the gender gap
The gender gap was visible in the way men and women voted during the presidential elections.
the generation gap
Taste in music is a good indicator of the generation gap.
an age gap
Despite the age gap, they became good friends.
a cultural gap
There is a cultural gap between Europe and America on this subject.
bridge/close/narrow the gap
The book aims to bridge the gap between theory and practice.
The policies are designed to close the gap between rich and poor.
the gap narrows
Polls show the gap between the two candidates has narrowed.
widen the gap
Technology has widened the gap between people with and without computer skills.
the gap widens
The gap is widening between the incomes of the rich and the less well-off.
a gap exists
A cultural gap exists between the older and the younger generations.
gap.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: a US clothes company with stores all over the world. The Gap sells informal clothes for men, women, and children, which are fashionable but not very expensive.
gap.translation[2].definitions[0].defini: an opportunity to develop and sell a particular product or service because no other company is doing this yet
gap.translation[2].definitions[0].exampl: The sales director believes there is a gap in the market for small jets.
The mail-order company is aiming to fill the gap in the market with a range of swimwear for older people.
gap.translation[2].definitions[1].defini: a difference between two situations, amounts, groups of people etc
gap.translation[2].definitions[1].exampl: Brazil had a trade gap (=difference in value of what a country buys from abroad and what it sells) of $3.16 billion last year.
the gap between the earnings of manual and non-manual workers
gap.translation[2].definitions[2].defini: something that is missing that stops something else from being complete
gap.translation[2].definitions[2].exampl: The computer manufacturer is trying to fill a gap in its product line by buying an Atlanta software firm for $65 million.
